solution_line_template: Larry's shoulder height is {shoulder_percent_less_num}% less than {larry_height} feet, or {shoulder_percent_less_decimal}*{larry_height} =<<{shoulder_percent_less_num}*{percent_factor}*{larry_height}={shoulder_height_difference}>>{shoulder_height_difference} foot less than {larry_height} feet.
One foot less than {larry_height} feet is {larry_height}-{shoulder_height_difference}=<<{larry_height}-{shoulder_height_difference}={larry_shoulder_height}>>{larry_shoulder_height} feet.
If Barry stands on Larry's shoulders, they can reach {larry_shoulder_height}+{barry_reach}=<<{larry_shoulder_height}+{barry_reach}={combined_reach}>>{combined_reach} feet.
